summary: This document is a series of weekly intelligence operations reports from FBI Squad 1D-13, covering April through October 2021. It details the ongoing trial preparation for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, focusing on the systematic review, categorization, and marking of digital images (including CSAM) for use as trial exhibits.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the joint 'Epstein/Maxwell investigation' for which trial preparation is being conducted.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the joint 'Epstein/Maxwell investigation' for which trial preparation is being conducted.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: The primary FBI specialist conducting the review of images, meeting with case agents, and categorizing evidence for trial preparation.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Works with the case agent and SOS regarding case updates and trial preparation for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: AUSAs
persons.context: Prosecutors who will determine which categorized images will be used for trial.

connections.description: Jointly referenced as subjects of the same investigation, indicating their alleged involvement in connected criminal activities.
Work closely together on reviewing and categorizing digital evidence for the Epstein/Maxwell trial preparation.
Regularly meet with the detective and case agent for updates and coordination on the investigation.
Work together as the lead investigative team (case agent and detective) on the Epstein/Maxwell case.
SOS categorizes evidence into groups necessary for the AUSAs to select trial exhibits.

events.title: Trial Prep Evidence Review Begins
events.description: SOS begins assisting with reviewing evidence, specifically images, for the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Discovery of CSAM During Evidence Review
events.description: SOS, while reviewing devices processed by CART, comes across several images constituting Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM). SA advises on marking them, and some are reviewed together.

events.title: Completion of Initial Image Review
events.description: SOS completes a priority review of approximately 38,934 images, marking them for categories like victims and individuals of interest.

events.title: Trial Exhibit Selection Process
events.description: SOS reviews a list of images selected for trial exhibits, matching them with evidence numbers, locations, and descriptions.

keyFacts: During evidence review for the Epstein/Maxwell trial in August 2021, FBI specialists discovered several images constituting Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM) on processed devices.
By late August 2021, an FBI specialist had reviewed and marked approximately 38,934 images, categorizing them into folders for 'victims and individuals of interest' as part of trial preparation.
The document outlines a systematic, multi-month process from April to October 2021 where law enforcement reviewed and categorized digital evidence to build trial exhibits for the prosecution.
The investigation is consistently referred to as the 'Epstein/Maxwell investigation,' indicating their cases were being prepared jointly at this stage.
Marked CSAM images were to be sent to the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children (NCMEC) after review was completed.
